text:
I dont know quite how ant has managed to get into a complete mess on my home 
box (winxp rc2/java1.3.1) but now ant does not run with a very odd failure: A 
verify error in the ant class loader; the exact location varies depending on 
what I do, but the string related verify error is consistent. The bootstrap 
version of ant still works...

java.lang.VerifyError: (class: org/apache/tools/ant/AntClassLoader, method: 
find ClassInComponents signature: (Ljava/lang/String;)Ljava/lang/Class;) 
Accessing value from uninitialized register 7
        at org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.Definer.createLoader(Definer.java)
        at org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.Definer.execute(Definer.java)
        at org.apache.tools.ant.Task.perform(Task.java)
        at org.apache.tools.ant.Target.execute(Target.java)
        at org.apache.tools.ant.Target.performTasks(Target.java)
        at org.apache.tools.ant.Project.executeTarget(Project.java)
        at org.apache.tools.ant.Project.executeTargets(Project.java)
        at org.apache.tools.ant.Main.runBuild(Main.java)
        at org.apache.tools.ant.Main.start(Main.java)
        at org.apache.tools.ant.Main.main(Main.java)
creator: steve_l@iseran.com
steve_l@iseran.com
text: A clean bootstrap as well as clean build made it all go away. wierd.
